data.name: Lick Of Paint
data.description:
# Scenario 

**_This week_** the *paints are on sale* . A father and his son *want to paint* a **_bordered section of a wall_** . 

___

# Task

**_Given_** *three borders of the target section*,

**_Find_** **_How much paint they need to paint the section_**    ![!alt](https://i.imgur.com/mdX8dJP.png) ![!alt](https://i.imgur.com/mdX8dJP.png)

___

# Notes

* **_Borders_** *are given* **_in meters_** .

*  **_Borders_** *Of Course always* **_Positive_** .

* **_The Result_** *should* be **_precise up to two decimal places_** 

*  **_Have no fear_**  , **_Borders_** *passed in* **_double (datatype)_** *to keep precision sharp and have fun when operating*  ![!alt](https://i.imgur.com/mdX8dJP.png)

____

# Input >> Output Examples:

```cpp
1- lickOfPaint (8 , 2 , 7)  ==> return (6.44)
```

## **_Explanation_**:

**_The Area_** *they need to* **_paint_** is  **_6.44_** . 
___

```cpp
2- lickOfPaint (17 , 20 , 14)  ==> return (117.09)
```

## **_Explanation_**:

**_The Area_** *they need to* **_paint_** is  **_117.09_** . 
___

```cpp
3- lickOfPaint (90 , 81 , 69)  ==> return (2675.89)
```

## **_Explanation_**:

**_The Area_** *they need to* **_paint_** is  **_2675.89_** .  

___
___
___
